page.title: 06 Future Housing For Rushden
page.content: If any development is to take place the builders must have planning permission. In 1980 owners of land at Manor Farm had to outline plans and fill in an application form. The site covers 35.6 acres on the Manor Farm estate and will include 300 dwellings. They were given planning permission on 21st June, 1983. It took 2 years to sort out details. When permission was given they filled in 3.5 pages of conditions. There were 22 conditions altogether. For 17 houses there were just a few conditions. Probably owners would get full permission soon to start building. Houses are to be developed in six phases. Mostly 3-4 bedroom and terraced houses. There will be over 3 acres of houses in the 1st stage. They also have to sort out sewage and drainage.
